extraction.title: Enable import of waypoints
extraction.description: Issue by jpmens from Thursday Jan 30, 2014 at 18:04 GMT Originally opened as binarybucks/mqttitude#311As discussed on the ML: we'll enable import of waypoints from a file (.mqtw) (MQTTitude Waypoints) similarly to import of configurationsWaypoint export will not be required, as these are (mostly anyway) published to the back-end from which they can be exported.
extraction.comments: Comment by ckrey from Friday Jan 31, 2014 at 22:58 GMTWaypoint file: .mqtw Key of the waypoints is tst.Example: Comment by ckrey from Saturday Feb 01, 2014 at 11:09 GMTDone in IOS. Will be available in App Store 5.7 or already now on github Comment by jpmens from Saturday Feb 01, 2014 at 13:52 GMTCreation of a waypoint (manually) adds an acc element to the payload.What is that? :) Comment by jpmens from Saturday Feb 01, 2014 at 13:54 GMTSometimes 0, sometimes 5. Looks like a bug Comment by jpmens from Saturday Feb 01, 2014 at 13:56 GMTThe accuracy is being carried over from last location pub.Anyhow, it's wrong. Please remove from _type=waypoint payload Comment by jpmens from Monday Feb 03, 2014 at 07:28 GMTRelated to #316 (batt also superflous) Comment by ckrey from Monday Feb 03, 2014 at 13:41 GMTdone! File Name = .otrw .mqtw That just might take 're-branding' a touch too far ... Ok, I'll support both waypoint import is already possible via waypoints attribute of configuration message. For reference see https://github.com/owntracks/owntracks/wiki/JSON#_typeconfiguration
